alert.note: Alert for Sawyer; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 17 at 9:09PM CST until December 17 at 9:45PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: The National Weather Service in Duluth MN has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southern Washburn County in northwestern Wisconsin... Southwestern Sawyer County in northwestern Wisconsin... * Until 945 PM CST. * At 907 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located 7 miles southeast of Trego, or 8 miles east of Spooner, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams on US Highway 53. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. * This snow squall will impact Highway 70 east of Spooner. This snow squall will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Washburn and southwestern Sawyer Counties. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
